qas.question: Britain competed with which country to fill the Asian power vacuum in the 19th century?
When did Britain first invade Afghanistan?
What was the British-Russian rivalry called?
Britain feared Russia would invade what country/territory?
Russian victories against which countries increased British fears?

context: During the 19th century, Britain and the <a0_0>Russian<a0_0/> Empire vied to fill the power vacuums that had been left by the declining Ottoman Empire, Qajar dynasty and Qing Dynasty. This rivalry in Eurasia came to be known as <a2_0>the "Great Game"<a2_0/>. As far as Britain was concerned, defeats inflicted by Russia on <a4_0>Persia and Turkey<a4_0/> demonstrated its imperial ambitions and capabilities and stoked fears in Britain of an overland invasion of <a3_0>India<a3_0/>. In <a1_0>1839<a1_0/>, Britain moved to pre-empt this by invading Afghanistan, but the First Anglo-Afghan War was a disaster for Britain.
